intro: Gardenia dacryoides, commonly known as the white gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowers are not only beautiful but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
